original_title: Sri Lanka tourism arrivals up from last year in May, but below April
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka has welcomed 75,767 tourists up to May 28, 2023, sharply up from 30,207 from a year ago, but lower from April, data from the tourism promotion office shows.
In April Sri Lanka welcomed 105,498 tourists, down from 125,495 in March.
The period between April and June is in the so-called ‘off-season’ that comes immediately after the European winter season ends.
Sri Lanka’s tourist officials say off season hotel prices in Colombo are falling amid competition,
Sri Lanka’s tourism was hit last year after a currency crisis and forex shortages led to power and fuel disruptions just as the country recovered from the Covid pandemic.
Sri Lanka’s tourism authorities are expected to welcome 2.5 million tourists in 2023. (can you check this story and link the old one as a related one.
